title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: Prosecutors in South Korea have indicted the heads of the app-based car-sharing service Tada on charges of running a transportation business without a license.The Seoul Central District Prosecutors' Office said on Monday that SoCar's CEO Lee Jae-woong and chief executive of SoCar's rental car hailing service unit, Value Creators and Company, Park Jae-uk will face trail without physical detention.This comes amid formal complaints among taxi drivers who see these types of services as being illegal.The court is expected to focus on whether Tada should be considered as a type of rental car service, which is legal, or an illegal taxi service operating without a license.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
